snippet: A federal court was right to block for this election cycle a photo ID law that would have disenfranchised vulnerable voters.
abstract: Editorial praises decision by three-judge federal panel blocking South Carolina's restrictive new voter photo ID law until after November elections; notes decision hinged on Section 5 of  Voting Rights Act, provision that will come under scrutiny by the Supreme Court in its current term.
lead_paragraph: A federal court was right to block for this election cycle a photo ID law that would have disenfranchised vulnerable voters.
